sub_title: Chief of Staff at FeedbackFruits | DE&I, EdTech & Web3
summary:
Equal parts curious and collaborative, with a strong understanding of business, information technology, and customer-centred design. A master orchestrator and strategy driver who enjoys leading a team with empathy. EdTech enthusiast with big-interest-energy for Web3. 

Experienced in Team Building, Project Management, Strategic Programme Management, Internal Communications, Operations, Design Thinking and DE&I. 

Passionate about education, animals, people and the planet.

lydiakronawetter.com

education.field_of_study: Art History and Theory, and Anthropology
French, English, Classics, Art History, Geography

awards.title: Gold Club Award
awards.description: The Gold Club Award recognises the extraordinary performance of individuals who transform and contribute to the overall success and growth of Microsoft. Recipients demonstrated significant impact to business results through growth mindset, transformational deals and acting in the spirit of One Microsoft.

awards.title: Finalist for Rising Star Category
awards.description: This award recognises a standout candidate rising through the ranks within the ICT industry, acknowledging significant advancement during the early stages of her technology career. This individual is growing in stature and importance through demonstrating outstanding business acumen, deep market expertise and high levels of professional integrity.
awards.issuer: Reseller News Women in ICT Awards 2022

awards.title: Branded Mammoth
awards.description: Awarded to the person who best lives by Isobar's values most consistently.

awards.title: Outstanding Service to School Award
awards.description: Awarded to the student deemed to have contributed most significantly to both the community and the culture of the school throughout their studies at Christchurch Girls' High School.

profile_positions.description:
In my role as Chief of Staff, I lead process, projects, internal communication and our People & Culture strategy. I am responsible for planning and managing all operational activities for the CEO, as well as implementing new ideas and strategies. Essentially, rolling up my sleeves to make the boat go faster.

—

Key skills: 

Executing significant strategic, operational, and cultural initiatives 
Change management
Communication 
Decision making and problem solving 
Critical thinking
Thought partner to CEO and COO
Managing our fantastic People & Culture team
profile_positions.title: Chief of Staff

profile_positions.description:
In my role as Industry Executive for Education, I led the Primary and Secondary Education (K-12) team for Microsoft Aotearoa (New Zealand). This advisory role saw me focused on partner and account management to drive revenue and usage of our Microsoft Education core products, ensuring our technology meaningfully transformed the in-class and whole system experience to deliver better, more equitable learning outcomes for all. 

—

Key achievements: 

Winner of the Microsoft Gold Club Award 2022 for outstanding individual performance
Finalist for New Zealand Women in IT Rising Star Award 2022

—

Key skills: 

Driving and coaching cross-functional, engaged teams
Translating technical concepts for customers
Community engagement strategies 
Strategic programme management
Design thinking workshop facilitation
Crafting a compelling narrative for
stakeholders and senior leaders
Marketing and PR collaborations
Budget management
Data-driven decision making
Sales pipeline management
Leadership with empathy

—

In addition to my role, I was a proud member of the Māori and Pasifika ERG, leading our digital skilling for indigenous young people workstream, and a member of our LGBTQ+ GLEAM ERG, leading our internal events workstream.
profile_positions.title: Industry Executive, Education

profile_positions.description:
As Account Executive, I worked to strategically drive New Zealand's health sector by leveraging Microsoft's technologies, solutions and services.

—

Key skills:

V-team enablement 
Account management
Pipeline planning and orchestration
Industry event management 
Industry marketing
profile_positions.title: Associate Account Executive, Public Sector

profile_positions.description:
Isobar is a global digital experience agency. Rooted in the principles of design thinking, experience design and agile, it's part of the worldwide Dentsu Group. 

As Client Experience Director at Isobar, I was focused on supporting my team to foster strong, long-lasting client relationships with high-growth businesses and tech startups. I was responsible for shaping and delivering the services we offered to our clients, helping them define and create world-class customer experiences through the smart use of technology. I was responsible for driving new business and managing business revenue. 

Clients included Rocket Lab, Ask Nicely, Halter, ArchiPro, Serko, Centrality and Re: News. 

—

Key skills: 

Creating and presenting a compelling narrative for stakeholders and customers
Understanding of SaaS, PaaS, technology platforms and services 
Creation of customer acquisition and retention strategies 
CX and design thinking methodologies and research
Identification of strategic market opportunities 
Product roadmap planning and management 
Driving cross-functional, engaged teams 
Sales pipeline management 
Data-driven decision making 
Agile sprint methodologies 
Leadership with empathy

—

In addition to my role, I represented Isobar NZ on our Dentsu Aegis Network NZ Diversity & Inclusion Council, I was a member of our DAN 'Women in Leadership' working group and a key organiser of our inaugural Shadow Tech mentoring event and I led our community partnership programme with Manurewa High School's Business Academy.
profile_positions.title: Client Experience Director

profile_positions.description:
As a Client Partner at Isobar NZ (previously Little Giant), I was focused on fostering and growing our client relationships through strategic insight and opportunity identification. 

Working closely alongside our delivery department, I managed key stakeholder relations and applied strategic input from the idea to inception of a project, ensuring we seamlessly blended creativity and technology to transform our clients' businesses. 

—

Key skills: 

Client relationship management
Digital strategy ideation and implementation 
Web strategy ideation and implementation
Cross-functional team management 
Responsible for budget and timeline milestones
Understanding of current and upcoming digital trends
Understanding of technology platforms and services
Strong verbal and written communication
profile_positions.title: Client Partner

profile_positions.description:
As an Account Manager Isobar NZ (previously Little Giant), I was part of a passionate Client Services department. 

I managed digital solution ideation and execution, ranging from websites, web apps, native apps, CRM, PIM and API integrations, as well as brand strategy and ideation projects. 

I was responsible for sprint planning, productisation strategy, creative and development team management, budget management and ultimately, building a long lasting client relationship in conjunction with successful, beautiful digital assets. 

—

Key skills:

Stakeholder management 
Internal resource management 
Sprint and waterfall project management
Jira and Confluence tools 
Autonomous working 
Strong verbal and written communication
profile_positions.title: Account Manager

profile_positions.description:
Shuttlerock is a now-global, New Zealand-founded adtech startup, where I was lucky enough to be employee #29. 

As the Implementation Lead at Shuttlerock, I was responsible for ensuring that content, community and context successfully came together through the power of Shuttlerock's technology. 

Across all verticals, I loved bringing our clients' stories to life in an authentic and measurable way. From scoping innovative digital solutions to developing strategic implementation plans, I worked closely with our clients' internal teams and key partners to ensure successful execution of our software, providing continued advice and critical analysis throughout the relationship.

Being at the cutting edge of owned-media software, I was passionate about bringing our clients along for the journey as we continued to innovate and evolve at Shuttlerock. 

In addition, I facilitated on-going training for new staff members, created marketing collateral and supported day-to-day operations for our Auckland-based office.

—

Key skills:

Project management 
Account management 
Liaising with technical teams
QA and testing 
User experience analysis
HR and internal process creation
profile_positions.title: Implementation Specialist

profile_positions.description:
As a Success Manager at Shuttlerock, I was charged with ensuring that our clients effectively leveraged the power of our software across all of their brands' owned digital assets.

I was the first port of call for any curly questions and as a result I worked closely with our development and design teams to deliver the best and most innovative solutions possible for our varied portfolio of clients.

—

Key skills:

Account management
Content marketing 
Copywriting for whitepapers
Outbound sales
Sales pipeline management
HR and internal process creation
profile_positions.title: Customer Success Manager

profile_positions.description:
Whilst working at Harcourts Grenadier, I was responsible for extensive diary, database and advertising systems management. 

In addition, I also assisted in writing and editing marketing literature, as well as liaising with the client services team and senior management team to ensure critical information was delivered to all stakeholders.

—

Key skills:

Customer service
CMS administration 
Office management
Copywriting
profile_positions.title: Content Administrator

volunteer_experiences.description: As a Shine After Hours Advocate, I performed call-outs during the evenings and the weekends to support victims of family and and intimate partner violence. Our visits were designed to provide the victim with immediate support, risk assessment and safety planning to ensure they are supported to make decisions about a future safe from family violence.

volunteer_experiences.role: Fundraising and Events Assistant, Foster Puppy Parent
volunteer_experiences.description:
Based in Auckland, our small team are dedicated to rescuing puppies and providing them with training, socialisation, health care and love so they can go on to lead happy lives once adopted.

We are also passionate about the benefits of de-sexing dogs to avoid bringing more unwanted pups into the world. 

I assist with fundraising events, adoption days and general miscellaneous, puppy-related tasks. Most recently, I have also had the joy and privilege of fostering pups in our home.

Unlike other hospices, Dove Hospice supports people who have a terminal prognosis and those who expect full recovery, bridging the gap between diagnosis and end of life, or diagnosis and wellness. 

I assisted with the Dove Hospice Shop Remuera on a weekly basis, working with customers and donators to raise funds.

company.name: The Physics Room Contemporary Art Space

volunteer_experiences.description:
The Physics Room is a contemporary art space dedicated to developing and promoting contemporary art and critical discourse in Aotearoa New Zealand.

I volunteered as a weekly gallery assistant, as well as supported with events and publication writing, during my university studies.
